title: Usage Wizard
subtitle: From config check to daily use — unlock your AI assistant's full potential
welcomeGuide: This wizard checks your config and guides you step by step. Click any section below to start.
readinessAlmost: Almost ready, consider completing the following
recommendModel: Configure an AI model first — this is the most important setting
recommendChannel: Connect a messaging channel to start chatting with AI
recommendPersona: Define AI's personality to make it truly yours
recommendScenario: Pick a scenario to get started quickly
recommendExplore: Explore advanced features to unlock AI's full potential
webUiAvailable: You can chat with AI directly via the Web UI
secModelDesc: Configure AI providers and models — the most important setting
secPersonaDesc: Define your AI assistant's personality, identity, and behavior
secAutoDesc: Let your AI assistant proactively check tasks and messages
secChannelDesc: Connect chat apps to talk with your AI assistant
fallback: Fallback model (auto-switch when primary is down)
heartbeatModel: Heartbeat model (for periodic checks, use a cheap model)
noFallback: Add a fallback model for automatic failover
noHeartbeatModel: Use a cheap model to significantly reduce costs
noSubagentModel: Use a mid-tier model to save on background tasks
personaDesc: Define your AI assistant's personality and behavior
automationDesc: Let your AI proactively check tasks on a schedule
heartbeatOff: Periodic checks are off. Enable to let AI proactively check messages and tasks
heartbeatConfigPath: Config Center → Automation → Enable heartbeat and set interval
channelDesc: Connect chat apps to talk with your AI assistant
modelGoEditorHint: Go to the Editor's Model Setup to configure providers and models
modelConfigPath: Config Center → Models → Providers / Primary Model / Fallback Models
noChannelHint: Go to the Editor's Channel Setup to connect a chat app
channelConfigPath: Config Center → Channels → Add channel and fill in Token
personaSubtitle: Make AI your personal assistant — define personality, identity, and behavior
personaQaSubtitle: Answer a few questions to auto-generate AI personality config
qaPersonalityPlaceholder: e.g. professional, witty, warm and caring
qaRolePlaceholder: e.g. personal assistant, tech advisor, study buddy
qaUserInfoPlaceholder: e.g. Software engineer, loves photography and travel, UTC+8
presetProfessionalDesc: Precise and efficient, accuracy-focused, ideal for work
presetFriendlyDesc: Casual and humorous, great for daily chat
presetButlerDesc: Thoughtful and caring, proactive, ideal for life assistant
presetScholarDesc: Knowledgeable and analytical, ideal for study and research
soulDesc: Define AI's core personality, behavior guidelines, and tone. This is the most important config file.
identityDesc: Define how AI introduces itself and behaves on different platforms. Don't dump everything into SOUL.md.
userDesc: Tell AI who you are: profession, preferences, timezone, languages. The more detail, the better it understands you.
agentsDesc: Define AI's operational boundaries: what it can do autonomously, what needs confirmation, tool permissions.
personaTip: Tip: Start with SOUL.md to define AI's core personality. Then gradually fill in the other files.
memoryToggleDesc: When enabled, AI remembers your conversations, preferences, and important info
memoryEx1: Remember your work habits and preferences
memoryEx4: Give more accurate suggestions based on history
memorySubtitle: Let AI remember everything — long-term memory, daily logs, and semantic search
memoryMdDesc: Store durable info: decisions, preferences, important facts. Only loaded in private sessions.
dailyLogDesc: Append-only daily records. Today's and yesterday's logs are auto-loaded at startup.
vectorSearchDesc: Let AI semantically search past memories. Supports OpenAI / Gemini / Voyage / local embeddings.
memoryFlushDesc: Auto-save important info when session nears compaction, preventing memory loss.
memoryTip: Tip: Tell AI "remember this" and it will write to memory files. Don't rely only on session memory.
configureSearch: Go to Config Center to enable vector search
memorySearchConfigPath: Config Center → Memory → Vector Search → Select Provider
autoTemplateDailyBriefDesc: Morning report: weather, schedule, and todos
autoTemplateReminderDesc: Send reminder messages at specified times
autoTemplateEmailCheckDesc: Periodically check unread emails and summarize
heartbeatExplain: Heartbeat: AI wakes up periodically and checks items in HEARTBEAT.md one by one
autoSubtitle: Let AI work proactively — heartbeat checks, cron jobs, and smart reminders
heartbeatDesc: Periodically wake AI to check tasks. Default 30min. Set active hours to avoid late-night pings.
heartbeatMdDesc: Define what AI checks during heartbeat: emails, calendar, task follow-ups, etc.
cronDesc: Precise time triggers: daily briefing, weekly report, timed reminders. For "do X every day at 9am".
cronVsHeartbeatDesc: Heartbeat batches multiple checks (email+calendar+notifications). Cron is for precise scheduling.
autoTip: Tip: Use a cheap model (e.g. Haiku) for heartbeat. Set activeHours to avoid burning tokens at night.
activeHoursDesc: Only run heartbeat during this time window
scenarioSubtitle: Pick a scenario to quickly configure your AI — 10x easier than manual editing
scenarioAssistantDesc: General-purpose assistant for Q&A, task management, and info lookup
scenarioEmailDesc: Auto-classify emails, extract key info, draft replies
scenarioCalendarDesc: View/create calendar events, meeting reminders, conflict detection
scenarioTaskDesc: Todo management, progress tracking, deadline reminders
scenarioDevDesc: Code review, issue management, CI/CD monitoring
scenarioKnowledgeDesc: Note organization, info archiving, knowledge base search
scenarioFamilyDesc: Family schedule coordination, shopping lists, reminders
scenarioTeamDesc: Multi-user AI, channel routing, permission management
scenarioEffectDesc: Your AI assistant will gain these abilities:
scenarioConfirm: Apply this scenario? It will append scenario-specific content to SOUL.md and HEARTBEAT.md.
tipsSubtitle: Master these tips to make your AI assistant even more effective
tipRoutingDesc: One AI serving Telegram + Discord + WhatsApp simultaneously, with different behavior per channel.
tipRoutingGuide: Config Center → Channels → Add channel and fill in Token
tipSessionDesc: /new to reset, /compact to compress context, per-sender vs per-channel scope.
tipSessionGuide: Config Center → Session → Set compaction threshold and scope
tipSecurityDesc: allowFrom whitelist, dmPolicy access control, sandbox mode.
tipSecurityGuide: Config Center → Channels → Select channel → Set dmPolicy and allowFrom
tipCostDesc: Use cheap models for heartbeat, set activeHours, tune compaction thresholds.
tipCostGuide: Config Center → Models → Set heartbeat model to a low-cost model (e.g. Haiku)
tipMultiAgentDesc: Different agents for different contexts (work vs personal), each with independent SOUL/MEMORY.
tipMultiAgentGuide: Config Center → Agents → Create agent and assign different channels
tipThinkingDesc: Enable extended thinking for AI to deeply reason through complex problems.
tipThinkingGuide: Config Center → Models → Enable reasoning option
